intro: Hieracium canomarginatum, commonly known as the narrow-margin hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in late spring to early summer, and it produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. Hieracium canomarginatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
